definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: He even calls her by a cute nickname, "Snips."
sentences.chinese: 他甚至用一個可愛的暱稱，“小鬼頭”來叫她。

sentences.english: Enter a nickname that indicates you are away.
sentences.chinese: 輸入一個象徵您已經離開的暱稱。

sentences.english: "I know a few good-looking broads, " Johnny said jokingly .
sentences.chinese: “我認識幾個漂亮女人，”約翰暱開玩笑他說。

sentences.english: The federated server retrieves this information during nickname registration.
sentences.chinese: 聯邦服務器在暱稱註冊時獲取這種信息。

sentences.english: A：What's the weather like in your country？
sentences.chinese: 你們國家的天氣情況是怎樣的暱？

sentences.english: It was supposed to be called "Little Phoenix" as it was his nickname.
sentences.chinese: 它被認爲是所謂的“小鳳凰”，因爲它是他的暱稱。

sentences.english: "Selecao", the nickname of the Brazil national team.
sentences.chinese: “桑巴軍團”是巴西國家足球隊的暱稱。

sentences.english: Even if you don't like her…
Brennan : I discovered something very interesting about cops and nicknames.
sentences.chinese: 我發現關於警察和暱稱的有趣的事。

sentences.english: This is the nickname in most Chinese military forums.
sentences.chinese: 這是大多數中國軍事論壇上的暱稱。

sentences.english: The nickname of The Big Apple first came from the sport of horserace.
sentences.chinese: 大蘋果的暱稱首先來自賽馬運動。

sentences.english: Messier used to have the nickname ' J2M'.
sentences.chinese: 管理風格米歇爾曾有個暱稱，叫‘j2m’。

sentences.english: The street where our church building is located has long had the nickname Skid Row.
sentences.chinese: 我們教會大樓座落的街道，長期被暱稱爲險滑路。

sentences.english: Nicknames act as local proxies to the remote tables or table-like data sets.
sentences.chinese: 暱稱作爲遠程表或類似於表的數據集的本地代理。

sentences.english: He even had one for my mother, Chief, because she was the boss.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至有個我媽媽的暱稱，頭兒，因爲她是老闆。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Colleran’s title is “global sales lead.”
sentences.chinese: 而克萊爾的暱稱是全球銷售首領。

definition: variant of 蒞|莅[li4], to attend
